Summary[Source](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/src/salvo/lib.rs.html#1-278)
Expand description
Salvo is a powerful web framework that can make your work easier.
`salvo` uses a set of [feature flags] to reduce the amount of compiled and optional dependencies.
## [§](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/#feature-flags)Feature flags
Feature| Description| Default?  
---|---|---  
`cookie`| Support for Cookie| ✔️  
`server`| Built-in Server implementation| ✔️  
`http1`| Support for HTTP 1.1 protocol| ✔️  
`http2`| Support for HTTP 2 protocol| ✔️  
`http2-cleartext`| Support for HTTP 2 over cleartext TCP| ❌  
`quinn`| Use [quinn](https://crates.io/crates/quinn) to support HTTP 3 protocol| ❌  
`test`| Utilities for testing application| ✔️  
`acme`| Automatically obtain certificates through ACME| ❌  
`rustls`| TLS built on [`rustls`](https://crates.io/crates/rustls)| ❌  
`openssl`| TLS built on [`openssl-tls`](https://crates.io/crates/openssl)| ❌  
`native-tls`| TLS built on [`native-tls`](https://crates.io/crates/native-tls)| ❌  
`unix`| Listener based on Unix socket| ❌  
`tower-compat`| Adapters for `tower::Layer` and `tower::Service`| ❌  
`anyhow`| Integrate with the [`anyhow`](https://crates.io/crates/anyhow) crate| ❌  
`eyre`| Integrate with the [`eyre`](https://crates.io/crates/eyre) crate| ❌  
`affix-state`| Middleware for adding prefix and suffix to the request path| ❌  
`craft`| Generate handlers or endpoints with shared data| ❌  
`basic-auth`| Middleware for basic authentication| ❌  
`caching-headers`| Middleware for setting caching headers| ❌  
`catch-panic`| Middleware for catching panics| ❌  
`concurrency-limiter`| Middleware for limiting concurrency| ❌  
`force-https`| Middleware for forcing HTTPS| ❌  
`logging`| Middleware for logging requests and responses| ❌  
`request-id`| Middleware for setting a request ID| ❌  
`size-limiter`| Middleware for limiting request size| ❌  
`sse`| Server-Sent Events (SSE) middleware| ❌  
`timeout`| Middleware for setting a timeout| ❌  
`trailing-slash`| Middleware for handling trailing slashes| ❌  
`websocket`| WebSocket implementation| ❌  
## Re-exports[§](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/#reexports)

`pub use salvo_cache[](https://docs.rs/salvo-cache/0.79.0/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/salvo_cache/index.html "mod salvo_cache") as cache;``cache`

`pub use salvo_csrf[](https://docs.rs/salvo-csrf/0.79.0/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/salvo_csrf/index.html "mod salvo_csrf") as csrf;``csrf`


`pub use salvo_flash[](https://docs.rs/salvo-flash/0.79.0/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/salvo_flash/index.html "mod salvo_flash") as flash;``flash`

## Modules[§](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/#modules)

[affix_state](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/affix_state/index.html "mod salvo::affix_state")`affix-state`
    Middleware for adding shared application state to the request context.

[basic_auth](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/basic_auth/index.html "mod salvo::basic_auth")`basic-auth`
    Middleware for HTTP Basic Authentication.

[caching_headers](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/caching_headers/index.html "mod salvo::caching_headers")`caching-headers`
    Middleware for handling ETag and Last-Modified headers.

[catch_panic](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/catch_panic/index.html "mod salvo::catch_panic")`catch-panic`
    Middleware for catch panic in handlers.

[catcher](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/catcher/index.html "mod salvo::catcher")
    Catch and handle errors.

[concurrency_limiter](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/concurrency_limiter/index.html "mod salvo::concurrency_limiter")`concurrency-limiter`
    Middleware for limiting concurrency.

[conn](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/conn/index.html "mod salvo::conn")
    Various listener implementations for handling HTTP connections.

[extract](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/extract/index.html "mod salvo::extract")
    Extract is a feature to let you deserialize request to custom type.

[force_https](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/force_https/index.html "mod salvo::force_https")`force-https`
    Middleware force redirect to https.

[fs](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/fs/index.html "mod salvo::fs")
    Filesystem module

[fuse](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/fuse/index.html "mod salvo::fuse")
    Protecting the server from slow HTTP attacks.

[handler](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/handler/index.html "mod salvo::handler")
    Handler module for handle [`Request`](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/struct.Request.html "struct salvo::Request").

[http](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/http/index.html "mod salvo::http")
    The HTTP related types and functions.

[hyper](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/hyper/index.html "mod salvo::hyper")
    hyper

[logging](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/logging/index.html "mod salvo::logging")`logging`
    A simple logging middleware.

[macros](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/macros/index.html "mod salvo::macros")
    The macros lib of Salvo web framework.

[prelude](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/prelude/index.html "mod salvo::prelude")
    A list of things that automatically imports into application use salvo.

[proto](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/proto/index.html "mod salvo::proto")
    Http protocol supports.

[request_id](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/request_id/index.html "mod salvo::request_id")`request-id`
    Request id middleware.

[routing](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/routing/index.html "mod salvo::routing")
    Routing and filters.

[rt](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/rt/index.html "mod salvo::rt")
    Runtime module.

[server](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/server/index.html "mod salvo::server")
    Server module

[size_limiter](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/size_limiter/index.html "mod salvo::size_limiter")`size-limiter`
    Middleware for limiting request size.

[sse](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/sse/index.html "mod salvo::sse")`sse`
    Middleware for Server-Sent Events (SSE)

[test](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/test/index.html "mod salvo::test")
    Utilities for testing application.

[timeout](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/timeout/index.html "mod salvo::timeout")`timeout`
    Middleware for controlling requests timeout.

[trailing_slash](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/trailing_slash/index.html "mod salvo::trailing_slash")`trailing-slash`
    Trailing slash middleware.

[websocket](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/websocket/index.html "mod salvo::websocket")`websocket`
    WebSocket implementation.

[writing](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/writing/index.html "mod salvo::writing")
    Writer trait and it’s implements.
## Structs[§](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/#structs)

[Depot](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/struct.Depot.html "struct salvo::Depot")
    Store temp data for current request.

[FlowCtrl](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/struct.FlowCtrl.html "struct salvo::FlowCtrl")
    Control the flow of execute handlers.

[Request](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/struct.Request.html "struct salvo::Request")
    Represents an HTTP request.

[Response](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/struct.Response.html "struct salvo::Response")
    Represents an HTTP response.

[Router](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/struct.Router.html "struct salvo::Router")
    Route request to different handlers.

[Server](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/struct.Server.html "struct salvo::Server")
    HTTP Server.

[Service](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/struct.Service.html "struct salvo::Service")
    Service http request.
## Enums[§](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/#enums)

[Error](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/enum.Error.html "enum salvo::Error")
    Errors that can happen inside salvo.
## Traits[§](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/#traits)

[Extractible](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/trait.Extractible.html "trait salvo::Extractible")
    If a type implements this trait, it will give a metadata, this will help request to extracts data to this type.

[Handler](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/trait.Handler.html "trait salvo::Handler")
    `Handler` is used for handle [`Request`](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/struct.Request.html "struct salvo::Request").

[Listener](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/trait.Listener.html "trait salvo::Listener")
    `Listener` represents a listener that can bind to a specific address and port and return an acceptor.

[Scribe](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/trait.Scribe.html "trait salvo::Scribe")
    `Scribe` is used to write data to [`Response`](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/struct.Response.html "struct salvo::Response").

[Writer](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/trait.Writer.html "trait salvo::Writer")
    `Writer` is used to write data to [`Response`](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/struct.Response.html "struct salvo::Response").
## Type Aliases[§](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/#types)

[BoxedError](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/type.BoxedError.html "type salvo::BoxedError")
    `BoxedError` is a boxed error type that can be used as a trait object.

[Result](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/type.Result.html "type salvo::Result")
    Result type which has `salvo::Error` as its error type.
## Attribute Macros[§](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/#attributes)

[async_trait](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/attr.async_trait.html "attr salvo::async_trait")


[handler](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/attr.handler.html "attr salvo::handler")
    `handler` is a macro to help create `Handler` from function or impl block easily.

Salvo is an extremely simple and powerful Rust web backend framework. Only basic Rust knowledge is required to develop backend services.
## 🎯 Features
  * Built with [Hyper 1](https://lib.rs/crates/hyper) and [Tokio](https://lib.rs/crates/tokio);
  * HTTP1, HTTP2 and **HTTP3** ;
  * Unified middleware and handle interface;
  * Router can be nested infinitely, and multiple middlewares can be attached to any router;
  * Integrated Multipart form processing;
  * Support WebSocket, WebTransport;
  * Support OpenAPI, generate OpenAPI data automatic;
  * Support Acme, automatically get TLS certificate from [let's encrypt](https://letsencrypt.org/);
  * Support Tower Service and Layer;


## ⚡️ Quick Start
You can view samples [here](https://github.com/salvo-rs/salvo/tree/main/examples), or view [official website](https://salvo.rs).
### Hello World with ACME and HTTP3
**It only takes a few lines of code to implement a server that supports ACME to automatically obtain certificates, and it supports HTTP1, HTTP2, and HTTP3 protocols.**
```
``use` `salvo`::```prelude`::```*``;`
``#``[``handler``]``
async ``fn` `hello`````(``res``:` `&``mut` Response```)``````{`
  res`.``render``(``Text`::``Plain`(```"`Hello World`"```)``)``;`
```}```
``#``[``tokio`::`main``]``
async ``fn` `main`````(````)``````{`
  `let` `mut` router `=` `Router`::``new`(``)``.``get``(`hello`)``;`
  `let` listener `=` `TcpListener`::``new`(```"`0.0.0.0:443`"```)`
    `.``acme``(``)`
    `.``add_domain``(```"`test.salvo.rs`"```)` ``//` Replace this domain name with your own.`
    `.``http01_challenge``(``&``mut` router`)``.``quinn``(```"`0.0.0.0:443`"```)``;`
  `let` acceptor `=` listener`.``join``(``TcpListener`::``new`(```"`0.0.0.0:80`"```)``)``.``bind``(``)``.`await`;`
  `Server`::``new`(`acceptor`)``.``serve``(`router`)``.`await`;`
```}```
`
```

### Middleware
There is no difference between a Handler and a Middleware, A Middleware is just a Handler. **You can write middleware without knowing concepts like associated types and generic types. If you can write a function, then you can write middleware!!!**
```
``use` `salvo`::```http`::```header`::````{``self``,` HeaderValue```}```;`
`use` `salvo`::```prelude`::```*``;`
``#``[``handler``]``
async ``fn` `add_header`````(``res``:` `&``mut` Response```)``````{`
  res`.``headers_mut``(``)`
    `.``insert``(``header`::```SERVER``,` `HeaderValue`::``from_static`(```"`Salvo`"```)``)``;`
```}```
`
```

Then add it to router:
```
``Router`::``new`(``)``.``hoop``(`add_header`)``.``get``(`hello`)`
`
```

This is a very simple middleware, it adds a ``Header`` to the ``Response``, view [full source code](https://github.com/salvo-rs/salvo/blob/main/examples/middleware-add-header/src/main.rs).
### Chainable tree routing system
Normally we write routing like this:
```
``Router`::``with_path`(```"`articles`"```)``.``get``(`list_articles`)``.``post``(`create_article`)``;`
`Router`::``with_path`(```"`articles/{id}`"```)`
  `.``get``(`show_article`)`
  `.``patch``(`edit_article`)`
  `.``delete``(`delete_article`)``;`
`
```

Often, something like viewing articles and article lists does not require user login, but creating, editing, deleting articles, etc. require user login authentication permissions. The tree-like routing system in Salvo can meet this demand. We can write routers without user login together:
```
``Router`::``with_path`(```"`articles`"```)`
  `.``get``(`list_articles`)`
  `.``push``(``Router`::``with_path`(```"`{id}`"```)``.``get``(`show_article`)``)``;`
`
```

Then write the routers that require the user to login together, and use the corresponding middleware to verify whether the user is logged in:
```
``Router`::``with_path`(```"`articles`"```)`
  `.``hoop``(`auth_check`)`
  `.``push``(``Router`::``with_path`(```"`{id}`"```)``.``patch``(`edit_article`)``.``delete``(`delete_article`)``)``;`
`
```

Although these two routes have the same ```path``(```"`articles`"```)```, they can still be added to the same parent route at the same time, so the final route looks like this:
```
``Router`::``new`(``)`
  `.``push``(`
    `Router`::``with_path`(```"`articles`"```)`
      `.``get``(`list_articles`)`
      `.``push``(``Router`::``with_path`(```"`{id}`"```)``.``get``(`show_article`)``)``,`
  `)`
  `.``push``(`
    `Router`::``with_path`(```"`articles`"```)`
      `.``hoop``(`auth_check`)`
      `.``push``(``Router`::``with_path`(```"`{id}`"```)``.``patch``(`edit_article`)``.``delete``(`delete_article`)``)``,`
  `)``;`
`
```

````{`id```}```` matches a fragment in the path, under normal circumstances, the article``id`` is just a number, which we can use regular expressions to restrict ``id`` matching rules, ````r``"`{id|\d+}`"````.
You can also use ````{``*``*````}````, ````{``*``+````}```` or````{``*``?````}```` to match all remaining path fragments. In order to make the code more readable, you can also add appropriate name to make the path semantics more clear, for example: ````{``*``*`file_path```}````.
Some regular expressions for matching paths need to be used frequently, and it can be registered in advance, such as GUID:
```
``PathFilter`::``register_wisp_regex`(`
  ``"`guid`"```,`
  `Regex`::``new`(```"`[0-9a-fA-F]{8}-([0-9a-fA-F]{4}-){3}[0-9a-fA-F]{12}`"```)``.``unwrap``(``)``,`
`)``;`
`
```

This makes it more concise when path matching is required:
```
``Router`::``with_path`(```"`{id:guid}`"```)``.``get``(`index`)`
`
```

View [full source code](https://github.com/salvo-rs/salvo/blob/main/examples/routing-guid/src/main.rs)
### File upload
We can get file async by the function ``file`` in ``Request``:
```
```#``[``handler``]``
async ``fn` `upload`````(``req``:` `&``mut` Request, `res``:` `&``mut` Response```)``````{`
  `let` file `=` req`.``file``(```"`file`"```)``.`await`;`
  `if` `let` `Some``(`file`)` `=` file `{`
    `let` dest `=` `format!``(```"`temp/`{}``"```,` file`.``name``(``)``.``unwrap_or_else``(````|``````|`` ````"`file`"```.``into``(``)```)``)``;`
    `if` `let` `Err``(`e`)` `=` `tokio`::```fs`::``copy`(``&`file`.`path`,` `Path`::``new`(``&`dest`)``)``.`await `{`
      res`.``status_code``(``StatusCode`::```INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR``)``;`
    `}` `else` `{`
      res`.``render``(```"`Ok`"```)``;`
    `}`
  `}` `else` `{`
    res`.``status_code``(``StatusCode`::```BAD_REQUEST``)``;`
  `}`
```}```
`
```

### Extract data from request
You can easily get data from multiple different data sources and assemble it into the type you want. You can define a custom type first, for example:
```
```#``[``derive```(```Serialize`,` Deserialize`,` Extractible`,` Debug```)```]``
``///` Get the data field value from the body by default.`
``#``[``salvo```(`````extract``(````default_source``(`from `=` ``"`body`"```)````)`````)```]``
``struct` ````GoodMan``<``'a``>``````{`
  ``///` The id number is obtained from the request path parameter, and the data is automatically parsed as i64 type.`
  ``#``[``salvo```(`````extract``(````source``(`from `=` ``"`param`"```)````)`````)```]``
  `id``:` `i64`,
  ``///` Reference types can be used to avoid memory copying.`
  `username``:` `&``'a` `str`,
  `first_name``:` String,
  `last_name``:` String,
```}```
`
```

Then in ``Handler`` you can get the data like this:
```
```#``[``handler``]``
async ``fn` `edit`````(``req``:` `&``mut` Request```)``````{`
  `let` good_man`:` `GoodMan`<`'`_``>`` `=` req`.``extract``(``)``.`await`.``unwrap``(``)``;`
```}```
`
```

You can even pass the type directly to the function as a parameter, like this:
```
```#``[``handler``]``
async ``fn` `edit````<``'a``>`````(``good_man``:` `GoodMan`<``'a``>`````)``````{`
  res`.``render``(`Json`(`good_man`)``)``;`
```}```
`
```

View [full source code](https://github.com/salvo-rs/salvo/blob/main/examples/extract-nested/src/main.rs)
### OpenAPI Supported
Perfect support for OpenAPI can be achieved without making significant changes to the project.
```
```#``[``derive```(```Serialize`,` Deserialize`,` ToSchema`,` Debug```)```]``
``struct` ````MyObject``<`T`:` ToSchema `+` `std`::```fmt`::``Debug`>``````{`
  `value``:` T,
```}```
``#``[``endpoint``]``
async ``fn` `use_string`````(``body``:` `JsonBody`<`MyObject`<``String``>``>`````)```` ``->` String` ````{`
  `format!``(```"``{:?}``"```,` body`)`
```}```
``#``[``endpoint``]``
async ``fn` `use_i32`````(``body``:` `JsonBody`<`MyObject`<``i32``>``>`````)```` ``->` String` ````{`
  `format!``(```"``{:?}``"```,` body`)`
```}```
``#``[``endpoint``]``
async ``fn` `use_u64`````(``body``:` `JsonBody`<`MyObject`<``u64``>``>`````)```` ``->` String` ````{`
  `format!``(```"``{:?}``"```,` body`)`
```}```
``#``[``tokio`::`main``]``
async ``fn` `main`````(````)``````{`
  `tracing_subscriber`::``fmt`(``)``.``init``(``)``;`
  `let` router `=` `Router`::``new`(``)`
    `.``push``(``Router`::``with_path`(```"`i32`"```)``.``post``(`use_i32`)``)`
    `.``push``(``Router`::``with_path`(```"`u64`"```)``.``post``(`use_u64`)``)`
    `.``push``(``Router`::``with_path`(```"`string`"```)``.``post``(`use_string`)``)``;`
  `let` doc `=` `OpenApi`::``new`(```"`test api`"```,` ``"`0.0.1`"```)``.``merge_router``(``&`router`)``;`
  `let` router `=` router
    `.``push``(`doc`.``into_router``(```"`/api-doc/openapi.json`"```)``)`
    `.``push``(``SwaggerUi`::``new`(```"`/api-doc/openapi.json`"```)``.``into_router``(```"`swagger-ui`"```)``)``;`
  `let` acceptor `=` `TcpListener`::``new`(```"`127.0.0.1:5800`"```)``.``bind``(``)``.`await`;`
  `Server`::``new`(`acceptor`)``.``serve``(`router`)``.`await`;`
```}```
`
```

### 🛠️ Salvo CLI
Salvo CLI is a command-line tool that simplifies the creation of new Salvo projects, supporting templates for web APIs, websites, databases (including SQLite, PostgreSQL, and MySQL via SQLx, SeaORM, Diesel, Rbatis), and basic middleware. You can use [salvo-cli](https://github.com/salvo-rs/salvo-cli) to create a new Salvo project:
#### install
```
```cargo``` install salvo-cli`
`
```

#### create a new Salvo project
```
```salvo``` new project_name`
`
```

### More Examples
You can find more examples in [examples](https://github.com/salvo-rs/salvo/blob/c7627251b9e16eb0b1738c00d22e4830b7d42b9b/crates/salvo/examples/) folder. You can run these examples with the following command:
```
```cd``` examples`
``cargo``` run`` --`bin` example-basic-auth`
`
```

You can use any example name you want to run instead of ``basic-auth`` here.
## 🚀 Performance
Benchmark testing result can be found from here:
<https://web-frameworks-benchmark.netlify.app/result?l=rust>

Salvo is an extremely simple and powerful Rust web backend framework. Only basic Rust knowledge is required to develop backend services.
## 🎯 Features
  * Built with Hyper 1⟨21⟩ and Tokio⟨22⟩;
  * HTTP1, HTTP2 and **HTTP3** ;
  * Unified middleware and handle interface;
  * Router can be nested infinitely, and multiple middlewares can be attached to any router;
  * Integrated Multipart form processing;
  * Support WebSocket, WebTransport;
  * Support OpenAPI, generate OpenAPI data automatic;
  * Support Acme, automatically get TLS certificate from let's encrypt⟨23⟩;
  * Support Tower Service and Layer;


## ⚡️ Quick Start
You can view samples here⟨24⟩, or view official website⟨25⟩.
### Hello World with ACME and HTTP3
**It only takes a few lines of code to implement a server that supports ACME to automatically obtain certificates, and it supports HTTP1, HTTP2, and HTTP3 protocols.**
```
``use` `salvo`::```prelude`::```*``;`
``#``[``handler``]``
async ``fn` `hello`````(``res``:` `&``mut` Response```)``````{`
  res`.``render``(``Text`::``Plain`(```"`Hello World`"```)``)``;`
```}```
``#``[``tokio`::`main``]``
async ``fn` `main`````(````)``````{`
  `let` `mut` router `=` `Router`::``new`(``)``.``get``(`hello`)``;`
  `let` listener `=` `TcpListener`::``new`(```"`0.0.0.0:443`"```)`
    `.``acme``(``)`
    `.``add_domain``(```"`test.salvo.rs`"```)` ``//` Replace this domain name with your own.`
    `.``http01_challenge``(``&``mut` router`)``.``quinn``(```"`0.0.0.0:443`"```)``;`
  `let` acceptor `=` listener`.``join``(``TcpListener`::``new`(```"`0.0.0.0:80`"```)``)``.``bind``(``)``.`await`;`
  `Server`::``new`(`acceptor`)``.``serve``(`router`)``.`await`;`
```}```
`
```

### Middleware
There is no difference between a Handler and a Middleware, A Middleware is just a Handler. **You can write middleware without knowing concepts like associated types and generic types. If you can write a function, then you can write middleware!!!**
```
``use` `salvo`::```http`::```header`::````{``self``,` HeaderValue```}```;`
`use` `salvo`::```prelude`::```*``;`
``#``[``handler``]``
async ``fn` `add_header`````(``res``:` `&``mut` Response```)``````{`
  res`.``headers_mut``(``)`
    `.``insert``(``header`::```SERVER``,` `HeaderValue`::``from_static`(```"`Salvo`"```)``)``;`
```}```
`
```

Then add it to router:
```
``Router`::``new`(``)``.``hoop``(`add_header`)``.``get``(`hello`)`
`
```

This is a very simple middleware, it adds a ``Header`` to the ``Response``, view full source code⟨26⟩.
### Chainable tree routing system
Normally we write routing like this:
```
``Router`::``with_path`(```"`articles`"```)``.``get``(`list_articles`)``.``post``(`create_article`)``;`
`Router`::``with_path`(```"`articles/{id}`"```)`
  `.``get``(`show_article`)`
  `.``patch``(`edit_article`)`
  `.``delete``(`delete_article`)``;`
`
```

Often, something like viewing articles and article lists does not require user login, but creating, editing, deleting articles, etc. require user login authentication permissions. The tree-like routing system in Salvo can meet this demand. We can write routers without user login together:
```
``Router`::``with_path`(```"`articles`"```)`
  `.``get``(`list_articles`)`
  `.``push``(``Router`::``with_path`(```"`{id}`"```)``.``get``(`show_article`)``)``;`
`
```

Then write the routers that require the user to login together, and use the corresponding middleware to verify whether the user is logged in:
```
``Router`::``with_path`(```"`articles`"```)`
  `.``hoop``(`auth_check`)`
  `.``push``(``Router`::``with_path`(```"`{id}`"```)``.``patch``(`edit_article`)``.``delete``(`delete_article`)``)``;`
`
```

Although these two routes have the same ```path``(```"`articles`"```)```, they can still be added to the same parent route at the same time, so the final route looks like this:
```
``Router`::``new`(``)`
  `.``push``(`
    `Router`::``with_path`(```"`articles`"```)`
      `.``get``(`list_articles`)`
      `.``push``(``Router`::``with_path`(```"`{id}`"```)``.``get``(`show_article`)``)``,`
  `)`
  `.``push``(`
    `Router`::``with_path`(```"`articles`"```)`
      `.``hoop``(`auth_check`)`
      `.``push``(``Router`::``with_path`(```"`{id}`"```)``.``patch``(`edit_article`)``.``delete``(`delete_article`)``)``,`
  `)``;`
`
```

````{`id```}```` matches a fragment in the path, under normal circumstances, the article``id`` is just a number, which we can use regular expressions to restrict ``id`` matching rules, ````r``"`{id|\d+}`"````.
You can also use ````{``*``*````}````, ````{``*``+````}```` or````{``*``?````}```` to match all remaining path fragments. In order to make the code more readable, you can also add appropriate name to make the path semantics more clear, for example: ````{``*``*`file_path```}````.
Some regular expressions for matching paths need to be used frequently, and it can be registered in advance, such as GUID:
```
``PathFilter`::``register_wisp_regex`(`
  ``"`guid`"```,`
  `Regex`::``new`(```"`[0-9a-fA-F]{8}-([0-9a-fA-F]{4}-){3}[0-9a-fA-F]{12}`"```)``.``unwrap``(``)``,`
`)``;`
`
```

This makes it more concise when path matching is required:
```
``Router`::``with_path`(```"`{id:guid}`"```)``.``get``(`index`)`
`
```

### Extract data from request
You can easily get data from multiple different data sources and assemble it into the type you want. You can define a custom type first, for example:
```
```#``[``derive```(```Serialize`,` Deserialize`,` Extractible`,` Debug```)```]``
``///` Get the data field value from the body by default.`
``#``[``salvo```(`````extract``(````default_source``(`from `=` ``"`body`"```)````)`````)```]``
``struct` ````GoodMan``<``'a``>``````{`
  ``///` The id number is obtained from the request path parameter, and the data is automatically parsed as i64 type.`
  ``#``[``salvo```(`````extract``(````source``(`from `=` ``"`param`"```)````)`````)```]``
  `id``:` `i64`,
  ``///` Reference types can be used to avoid memory copying.`
  `username``:` `&``'a` `str`,
  `first_name``:` String,
  `last_name``:` String,
```}```
`
```

### 🛠️ Salvo CLI
Salvo CLI is a command-line tool that simplifies the creation of new Salvo projects, supporting templates for web APIs, websites, databases (including SQLite, PostgreSQL, and MySQL via SQLx, SeaORM, Diesel, Rbatis), and basic middleware. You can use salvo-cli⟨29⟩ to create a new Salvo project:
#### install
```
```cargo``` install salvo-cli`
`
```

#### create a new Salvo project
```
```salvo``` new project_name`
`
```

### More Examples
You can find more examples in examples⟨30⟩ folder. You can run these examples with the following command:
```
```cd``` examples`
``cargo``` run`` --`bin` example-basic-auth`
`
```

You can use any example name you want to run instead of ``basic-auth`` here.

readme.raw_markdown:
[](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/all.html "show sidebar")
# Crate salvoCopy item path
[Settings](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/settings.html)
[Help](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/help.html)
Summary[Source](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/src/salvo/lib.rs.html#1-278)
Expand description
Salvo is a powerful web framework that can make your work easier.
`salvo` uses a set of [feature flags] to reduce the amount of compiled and optional dependencies.
## [§](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/#feature-flags)Feature flags
Feature| Description| Default?  
---|---|---  
`cookie`| Support for Cookie| ✔️  
`server`| Built-in Server implementation| ✔️  
`http1`| Support for HTTP 1.1 protocol| ✔️  
`http2`| Support for HTTP 2 protocol| ✔️  
`http2-cleartext`| Support for HTTP 2 over cleartext TCP| ❌  
`quinn`| Use [quinn](https://crates.io/crates/quinn) to support HTTP 3 protocol| ❌  
`test`| Utilities for testing application| ✔️  
`acme`| Automatically obtain certificates through ACME| ❌  
`rustls`| TLS built on [`rustls`](https://crates.io/crates/rustls)| ❌  
`openssl`| TLS built on [`openssl-tls`](https://crates.io/crates/openssl)| ❌  
`native-tls`| TLS built on [`native-tls`](https://crates.io/crates/native-tls)| ❌  
`unix`| Listener based on Unix socket| ❌  
`tower-compat`| Adapters for `tower::Layer` and `tower::Service`| ❌  
`anyhow`| Integrate with the [`anyhow`](https://crates.io/crates/anyhow) crate| ❌  
`eyre`| Integrate with the [`eyre`](https://crates.io/crates/eyre) crate| ❌  
`affix-state`| Middleware for adding prefix and suffix to the request path| ❌  
`craft`| Generate handlers or endpoints with shared data| ❌  
`basic-auth`| Middleware for basic authentication| ❌  
`caching-headers`| Middleware for setting caching headers| ❌  
`catch-panic`| Middleware for catching panics| ❌  
`concurrency-limiter`| Middleware for limiting concurrency| ❌  
`force-https`| Middleware for forcing HTTPS| ❌  
`logging`| Middleware for logging requests and responses| ❌  
`request-id`| Middleware for setting a request ID| ❌  
`size-limiter`| Middleware for limiting request size| ❌  
`sse`| Server-Sent Events (SSE) middleware| ❌  
`timeout`| Middleware for setting a timeout| ❌  
`trailing-slash`| Middleware for handling trailing slashes| ❌  
`websocket`| WebSocket implementation| ❌  
## Re-exports[§](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/#reexports)

`pub use salvo_cache[](https://docs.rs/salvo-cache/0.79.0/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/salvo_cache/index.html "mod salvo_cache") as cache;``cache`


`pub use salvo_compression[](https://docs.rs/salvo-compression/0.79.0/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/salvo_compression/index.html "mod salvo_compression") as compression;``compression`


`pub use salvo_cors[](https://docs.rs/salvo-cors/0.79.0/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/salvo_cors/index.html "mod salvo_cors") as cors;``cors`


`pub use salvo_csrf[](https://docs.rs/salvo-csrf/0.79.0/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/salvo_csrf/index.html "mod salvo_csrf") as csrf;``csrf`


`pub use salvo_flash[](https://docs.rs/salvo-flash/0.79.0/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/salvo_flash/index.html "mod salvo_flash") as flash;``flash`


`pub use salvo_jwt_auth[](https://docs.rs/salvo-jwt-auth/0.79.0/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/salvo_jwt_auth/index.html "mod salvo_jwt_auth") as jwt_auth;``jwt-auth`


`pub use salvo_proxy[](https://docs.rs/salvo-proxy/0.79.0/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/salvo_proxy/index.html "mod salvo_proxy") as proxy;``proxy`


`pub use salvo_rate_limiter[](https://docs.rs/salvo-rate-limiter/0.79.0/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/salvo_rate_limiter/index.html "mod salvo_rate_limiter") as rate_limiter;``rate-limiter`


`pub use salvo_session[](https://docs.rs/salvo-session/0.79.0/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/salvo_session/index.html "mod salvo_session") as session;``session`


`pub use salvo_serve_static[](https://docs.rs/salvo-serve-static/0.79.0/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/salvo_serve_static/index.html "mod salvo_serve_static") as serve_static;``serve-static`


`pub use salvo_otel[](https://docs.rs/salvo-otel/0.79.0/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/salvo_otel/index.html "mod salvo_otel") as otel;``otel`


`pub use salvo_oapi[](https://docs.rs/salvo-oapi/0.79.0/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/salvo_oapi/index.html "mod salvo_oapi") as oapi;``oapi`


`pub use salvo_core[](https://docs.rs/salvo_core/0.79.0/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/salvo_core/index.html "mod salvo_core") as core;`


`pub use salvo_craft[](https://docs.rs/salvo-craft/0.79.0/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/salvo_craft/index.html "mod salvo_craft") as craft;``craft`

## Modules[§](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/#modules)

[affix_state](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/affix_state/index.html "mod salvo::affix_state")`affix-state`
    Middleware for adding shared application state to the request context.

[basic_auth](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/basic_auth/index.html "mod salvo::basic_auth")`basic-auth`
    Middleware for HTTP Basic Authentication.

[caching_headers](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/caching_headers/index.html "mod salvo::caching_headers")`caching-headers`
    Middleware for handling ETag and Last-Modified headers.

[catch_panic](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/catch_panic/index.html "mod salvo::catch_panic")`catch-panic`
    Middleware for catch panic in handlers.

[catcher](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/catcher/index.html "mod salvo::catcher")
    Catch and handle errors.

[concurrency_limiter](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/concurrency_limiter/index.html "mod salvo::concurrency_limiter")`concurrency-limiter`
    Middleware for limiting concurrency.

[conn](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/conn/index.html "mod salvo::conn")
    Various listener implementations for handling HTTP connections.

[extract](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/extract/index.html "mod salvo::extract")
    Extract is a feature to let you deserialize request to custom type.

[force_https](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/force_https/index.html "mod salvo::force_https")`force-https`
    Middleware force redirect to https.

[fs](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/fs/index.html "mod salvo::fs")
    Filesystem module

[fuse](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/fuse/index.html "mod salvo::fuse")
    Protecting the server from slow HTTP attacks.

[handler](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/handler/index.html "mod salvo::handler")
    Handler module for handle [`Request`](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/struct.Request.html "struct salvo::Request").

[http](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/http/index.html "mod salvo::http")
    The HTTP related types and functions.

[hyper](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/hyper/index.html "mod salvo::hyper")
    hyper

[logging](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/logging/index.html "mod salvo::logging")`logging`
    A simple logging middleware.

[macros](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/macros/index.html "mod salvo::macros")
    The macros lib of Salvo web framework.

[prelude](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/prelude/index.html "mod salvo::prelude")
    A list of things that automatically imports into application use salvo.

[proto](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/proto/index.html "mod salvo::proto")
    Http protocol supports.

[request_id](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/request_id/index.html "mod salvo::request_id")`request-id`
    Request id middleware.

[routing](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/routing/index.html "mod salvo::routing")
    Routing and filters.

[rt](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/rt/index.html "mod salvo::rt")
    Runtime module.

[server](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/server/index.html "mod salvo::server")
    Server module

[size_limiter](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/size_limiter/index.html "mod salvo::size_limiter")`size-limiter`
    Middleware for limiting request size.

[sse](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/sse/index.html "mod salvo::sse")`sse`
    Middleware for Server-Sent Events (SSE)

[test](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/test/index.html "mod salvo::test")
    Utilities for testing application.

[timeout](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/timeout/index.html "mod salvo::timeout")`timeout`
    Middleware for controlling requests timeout.

[trailing_slash](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/trailing_slash/index.html "mod salvo::trailing_slash")`trailing-slash`
    Trailing slash middleware.

[websocket](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/websocket/index.html "mod salvo::websocket")`websocket`
    WebSocket implementation.

[writing](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/writing/index.html "mod salvo::writing")
    Writer trait and it’s implements.
## Structs[§](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/#structs)

[Depot](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/struct.Depot.html "struct salvo::Depot")
    Store temp data for current request.

[FlowCtrl](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/struct.FlowCtrl.html "struct salvo::FlowCtrl")
    Control the flow of execute handlers.

[Request](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/struct.Request.html "struct salvo::Request")
    Represents an HTTP request.

[Response](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/struct.Response.html "struct salvo::Response")
    Represents an HTTP response.

[Router](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/struct.Router.html "struct salvo::Router")
    Route request to different handlers.

[Server](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/struct.Server.html "struct salvo::Server")
    HTTP Server.

[Service](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/struct.Service.html "struct salvo::Service")
    Service http request.
## Enums[§](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/#enums)

[Error](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/enum.Error.html "enum salvo::Error")
    Errors that can happen inside salvo.
## Traits[§](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/#traits)

[Extractible](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/trait.Extractible.html "trait salvo::Extractible")
    If a type implements this trait, it will give a metadata, this will help request to extracts data to this type.

[Handler](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/trait.Handler.html "trait salvo::Handler")
    `Handler` is used for handle [`Request`](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/struct.Request.html "struct salvo::Request").

[Listener](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/trait.Listener.html "trait salvo::Listener")
    `Listener` represents a listener that can bind to a specific address and port and return an acceptor.

[Scribe](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/trait.Scribe.html "trait salvo::Scribe")
    `Scribe` is used to write data to [`Response`](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/struct.Response.html "struct salvo::Response").

[Writer](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/trait.Writer.html "trait salvo::Writer")
    `Writer` is used to write data to [`Response`](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/struct.Response.html "struct salvo::Response").
## Type Aliases[§](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/#types)

[BoxedError](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/type.BoxedError.html "type salvo::BoxedError")
    `BoxedError` is a boxed error type that can be used as a trait object.

[Result](https://docs.rs/salvo/latest/salvo/type.Result.html "type salvo::Result")

Expand description
Salvo is a powerful web framework that can make your work easier.
`salvo` uses a set of [feature flags] to reduce the amount of compiled and optional dependencies.
## §⟨4⟩Feature flags
Feature| Description| Default?  
---|---|---  
`cookie`| Support for Cookie| ✔️  
`server`| Built-in Server implementation| ✔️  
`http1`| Support for HTTP 1.1 protocol| ✔️  
`http2`| Support for HTTP 2 protocol| ✔️  
`http2-cleartext`| Support for HTTP 2 over cleartext TCP| ❌  
`quinn`| Use quinn⟨5⟩ to support HTTP 3 protocol| ❌  
`test`| Utilities for testing application| ✔️  
`acme`| Automatically obtain certificates through ACME| ❌  
`rustls`| TLS built on `rustls`⟨6⟩| ❌  
`openssl`| TLS built on `openssl-tls`⟨7⟩| ❌  
`native-tls`| TLS built on `native-tls`⟨8⟩| ❌  
`unix`| Listener based on Unix socket| ❌  
`tower-compat`| Adapters for `tower::Layer` and `tower::Service`| ❌  
`anyhow`| Integrate with the `anyhow`⟨9⟩ crate| ❌  
`eyre`| Integrate with the `eyre`⟨10⟩ crate| ❌  
`affix-state`| Middleware for adding prefix and suffix to the request path| ❌  
`craft`| Generate handlers or endpoints with shared data| ❌  
`basic-auth`| Middleware for basic authentication| ❌  
`caching-headers`| Middleware for setting caching headers| ❌  
`catch-panic`| Middleware for catching panics| ❌  
`concurrency-limiter`| Middleware for limiting concurrency| ❌  
`force-https`| Middleware for forcing HTTPS| ❌  
`logging`| Middleware for logging requests and responses| ❌  
`request-id`| Middleware for setting a request ID| ❌  
`size-limiter`| Middleware for limiting request size| ❌  
`sse`| Server-Sent Events (SSE) middleware| ❌  
`timeout`| Middleware for setting a timeout| ❌  
`trailing-slash`| Middleware for handling trailing slashes| ❌  
`websocket`| WebSocket implementation| ❌

enriched_crate.readme_summary: The `salvo` crate is a powerful and modular web framework for building HTTP servers and applications in Rust. It supports HTTP/1.1, HTTP/2, and optional HTTP/3 via `quinn`, along with a rich set of middleware features such as logging, authentication, caching, concurrency limiting, and request size limiting. Additionally, it offers integrations with TLS libraries, WebSocket support, and various utilities for routing, error handling, and testing, making it highly customizable for diverse web development needs.
enriched_crate.factual_counterfactual:
### Pair 1: HTTP Protocol Support  
✅ Factual: The `salvo` crate supports both HTTP/1.1 and HTTP/2 protocols by default, as indicated by the enabled `http1` and `http2` feature flags.  
❌ Counterfactual: The `salvo` crate supports HTTP/3 protocol by default, leveraging the `quinn` crate integration.  

---

### Pair 2: Middleware Availability  
✅ Factual: The `salvo` crate provides middleware for basic authentication, caching headers, and concurrency limiting, but these features are disabled by default and require enabling specific feature flags.  
❌ Counterfactual: All middleware features, such as logging, basic authentication, and request ID assignment, are enabled by default in the `salvo` crate.  

---

### Pair 3: TLS Support  
✅ Factual: The `salvo` crate supports TLS via optional integrations with `rustls`, `openssl`, and `native-tls`, but none of these are enabled by default.  
❌ Counterfactual: The `salvo` crate has built-in TLS support enabled by default, requiring no external dependencies for secure connections.
